cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 380 mi SE of Galveston, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Turning northwest later today and tracking toward the Upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the TX-LA border (between Port Arthur, TX and Cameron, LA)

weather_observation.under_warning: Hurricane Warning and Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.watch_coast: No active tropical storm or hurricane watch for the Texas coast west of San Luis Pass
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: San Luis Pass, TX to Intracoastal City, LA; Storm Surge Warning: San Luis Pass, TX to the Mouth of the Mississippi River
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Upper Texas coast and southwest Louisiana coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds likely (72% chance) with a 31% chance of sustained 50-kt winds; hurricane-force gusts possible.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 3–5 ft inundation possible in Galveston Bay and the Texas City area, higher (6–9 ft) just to the east toward Port Bolivar.
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches of rain with locally higher totals possible, producing flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes, dangerous surf and rip currents along the Upper Texas coast.
